recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F. 
2. Season the beef with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. Sear the beef on all sides until browned. Remove from the heat and brush with Dijon mustard. 
3. In the same skillet, cook the mushrooms, shallots, garlic, and thyme until the mixture is dry. Season with salt and pepper. 
4. Roll out the puff pastry to a thickness of 1/4 inch. Spread the mushroom mixture over the pastry. Place the beef on top and wrap the pastry around it, sealing the edges with egg wash. 
5. Brush the top of the pastry with egg wash and bake for 40-45 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the beef is cooked to your desired temperature. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

1. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, salt, and pepper until well combined. 
2. Melt the butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the egg mixture and cook, stirring constantly, until the eggs are scrambled to your desired consistency. 
3. Serve immediately, garnished with chopped fresh chives.

1. Season the beef with salt and pepper. Dredge in the flour, shaking off any excess. 
2. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside. 
3. Add the onion and mushrooms to the skillet and cook
